alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:09PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Humboldt County through 545 PM PDT... At 509 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Paradise Valley, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Humboldt County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
